title: Gareth Southgate prepared to take England stars off if subjected to racist abuse in Bulgaria
text:

Gareth Southgate is ­prepared to take his England stars off the pitch if they are subjected to racist abuse in Bulgaria in eight days’ time.

FA security chiefs have been placed on high alert for the Euro qualifier in Sofia on October 14 after bigoted Bulgarian fans ­targeted players of both Kosovo and the Czech Republic during games in the summer.

Spotters will be posted around the ground to look out for trouble.

Southgate insists that security staff have been fully briefed on the protocols put in place by UEFA to beat the bigots after Danny Rose was targeted by racists in ­Montenegro in March.

And the ultimate sanction is for the game to be abandoned.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

Southgate said: “We are very clear about this now – because I have to say it was a little less ­clear about what we should do in ­Montenegro. We’ve seen in the last few weeks a couple of the games that have been stopped in Italy and where the referee made an ­announcement to the crowd.

“The next stage is that it would be stopped and the referee takes the players off the pitch.

“And the third step would be an abandonment of the game.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

(Image: Getty Images)

“That is the process now – and we are very clear across all of our staff about what would need to happen if there is any sign of racist abuse. We have an official ­position to report something if we hear it.”

The game will be played in front of a reduced crowd after UEFA ­ordered the Bulgarian FA to close a 5,000-seat section of the 44,000-capacity stadium as a ­punishment for the abuse meted out to players during the Kosovo and Czech Republic qualifiers.

Southgate’s squad will get a ­security briefing when they meet up at St George’s Park tomorrow ahead of Friday’s game in the Czech Republic.

Southgate added: “It’s important to pick it up with the players. We have had two home games since the Montenegro match.

“In Montenegro, a couple of the players were aware of something in the first half – but lots weren’t.

“Even at the end of the game, I was very aware of what happened but some on the bench didn’t hear.

“We all hope we’re not ­discussing this again at the end of the game in Sofia – but it’s important that our players are prepared.”
description: Bulgarian fans have previously targeted Kosovo and Czech Republic players this summer and the FA have put Gareth Southgate on red alert
